trans-unit.source: Project: Make a binary cash register
trans-unit.target: プロジェクト: Make a binary cash register

trans-unit.source: The unplugged activity uses a vending machine as a model for creating different combinations of binary place values.
trans-unit.target: The アンプラグド アクティビティ uses a vending machine as a model for creating different combinations of binary place values.

trans-unit.source: We found that for n coins, there is one and only one way to make every number between 0 and 2^n-1.
trans-unit.target: We found that for n coins, there is one and only one way to make every number between 0 and 2^n-1.

trans-unit.source: For this project, students should invent a paper and cardboard version of the binary counter, then program it to display the decimal value of those numbers.
trans-unit.target: For this project, students should invent a paper and cardboard version of the binary counter, then program it to display the 10進数の値 of those numbers.

trans-unit.source: Materials
trans-unit.target: Materials

trans-unit.source: Cardboard or heavy paper
trans-unit.target: Cardboard or heavy paper

trans-unit.source:
Copper tape - sources: >https://www.adafruit.com/product/1128
https://www.sparkfun.com/products/10561
trans-unit.target:
Copper tape - sources: >https://www.adafruit.com/product/1128
https://www.sparkfun.com/products/10561

trans-unit.source: 3 quarters or other heavy coins
trans-unit.target: 3 quarters or other heavy coins

trans-unit.source: Scissors
trans-unit.target: Scissors

trans-unit.source: Duct tape
trans-unit.target: Duct tape

trans-unit.source: /static/courses/csintro/binary/microbit-cash-register.png
trans-unit.target: /static/courses/csintro/binary/microbit-cash-register.png

trans-unit.source: micro:bit cash register
trans-unit.target: micro:bit cash register

trans-unit.source: Binary micro:bit Cash Register
trans-unit.target: Binary micro:bit Cash Register

trans-unit.source: Tips
trans-unit.target: Tips

trans-unit.source: This is one possible design for a binary cash register.
trans-unit.target: This is one possible design for a binary cash register.

trans-unit.source: We used coins and copper tape on a piece of cardboard.
trans-unit.target: We used coins and copper tape on a piece of cardboard.

trans-unit.source: Normally, the coins are flipped up (“off” or 0) and to indicate “on” or 1, the coin is flipped so it lays flat across both pieces of copper tape, completing the circuit so the micro:bit can detect that that pin has been activated, and calculates and displays the decimal value of the binary number that is indicated by the coins.
trans-unit.target: Normally, the coins are flipped up (“off” or 0) and to indicate “on” or 1, the coin is flipped so it lays flat across both pieces of copper tape, completing the circuit so the micro:bit can detect that that pin has been activated, and calculates and displays the 10進数の値 of the 2進数 that is indicated by the coins.

trans-unit.source: Copper tape is a thin, flexible strip of copper with an adhesive back.
trans-unit.target: Copper tape is a thin, flexible strip of copper with an adhesive back.

trans-unit.source: You can sometimes find copper tape at the hardware, sold as slug tape, to keep slugs out of your garden.
trans-unit.target: You can sometimes find copper tape at ハードウェア, sold as slug tape, to keep slugs out of your garden.

trans-unit.source: Usually, copper tape can conduct electricity even through the sticky side but if you are sticking one piece of copper tape to another, be sure to go over the connection with your fingernail, pressing it down firmly.
trans-unit.target: Usually, copper tape can conduct electricity even through the sticky side but if you are sticking one piece of copper tape to another, be sure to go over the connection with your fingernail, pressing it down firmly.

trans-unit.source: Because the micro:bit only has three pins, this binary register is limited to three place values.
trans-unit.target: Because the micro:bit only has three pins, this binary register is limited to three place values.

trans-unit.source: Students might use variables to represent each of the three place values, or they can simply keep a running total by adding the appropriate amount when each of the three pins is pressed.
trans-unit.target: Students might use variables to represent each of the three place values, or they can simply keep a running total by adding the appropriate amount when each of the three pins is pressed.

trans-unit.source: You can stick the micro:bit into place using some sticky tape, or you can create an actual holder.
trans-unit.target: You can stick the micro:bit into place using some sticky tape, or you can create an actual holder.

trans-unit.source: The copper tape connections are delicate though, so be careful when plugging and unplugging the power cable from the board.
trans-unit.target: The copper tape connections are delicate though, so be careful when plugging and unplugging the power cable from the board.

trans-unit.source: Binary cash register project
trans-unit.target: Binary cash register project

trans-unit.source: An implementation of the Binary Cash Register
trans-unit.target: An implementation of the Binary Cash Register

trans-unit.source: Extra mods
trans-unit.target: Extra mods

trans-unit.source: Write some code that will display the number in binary when you press the A button.
trans-unit.target: Write some code that will display the number in binary when you press Aボタン.

trans-unit.source: Think of a way to create more place values, perhaps by using a second micro:bit and a Radio connection.
trans-unit.target: Think of a way to create more place values, perhaps by using a second micro:bit and a Radio connection.

trans-unit.source: Optional project: Build a binary wristwatch
trans-unit.target: Optional プロジェクト Build a binary wristwatch

trans-unit.source: Write a program that will display the correct time (once set) on the micro:bit.
trans-unit.target: Write a program that will display the correct time (once set) on the micro:bit.

trans-unit.source: The 3-4 numbers displayed will be in binary (not decimal).
trans-unit.target: The 3-4 numbers displayed will be in binary (not decimal).

trans-unit.source: To make the strap of the wristwatch, put 2 pieces of duct tape back-to-back, and use velcro tabs as the fasteners
trans-unit.target: To make the strap of the wristwatch, put 2 pieces of duct tape back-to-back, and use velcro tabs as the fasteners

trans-unit.source: /static/courses/csintro/binary/binary-wrist-watch.jpg
trans-unit.target: /static/courses/csintro/binary/binary-wrist-watch.jpg

trans-unit.source: Binary wrist watch project
trans-unit.target: Binary wrist watch project

trans-unit.source: To make the strap of the wristwatch, you can put two pieces of duct tape back-to-back, and use Velcro tabs as the fasteners.
trans-unit.target: To make the strap of the wristwatch, you can put two pieces of duct tape back-to-back, and use Velcro tabs as the fasteners.

trans-unit.target: Holder

trans-unit.source: This is a holder that allows the micro:bit to be worn on the wrist.
trans-unit.target: This is a holder that allows the micro:bit to be worn on the wrist.

trans-unit.source: Wooden structure to hold the micro:bit on the wrist
trans-unit.target: Wooden structure to hold the micro:bit on the wrist

trans-unit.source: This design supports the micro:bit in a rigid cradle and allows more delicate connections to the pins.
trans-unit.target: This design supports the micro:bit in a rigid cradle and allows more delicate connections to the pins.

trans-unit.source: Reflection
trans-unit.target: 省察

trans-unit.source: Have students write a reflection of about 150–300 words, addressing the following points:
trans-unit.target: >生徒たちに以下の内容を含む１５０～３００字程度のレビューを書いてもらいましょう。:

trans-unit.source: Describe what the physical component of yur micro:bit project was (e.g., an armband, a cardboard mount, a holder, etc.)
trans-unit.target: Describe what the physical component of yur micro:bit project was (e.g., an armband, a cardboard mount, a holder, etc.)

trans-unit.source: How well did your prototype work? What were you happy with? What would you change?
trans-unit.target: How well did your prototype work? What were you happy with? What would you change?

trans-unit.source: What was something that was surprising to you about the process of creating this project?
trans-unit.target: What was something that was surprising to you about the process of creating this project?

trans-unit.source: Describe one way in which your project differed from the example that was given. How would you recognize it as your own?
trans-unit.target: Describe one way in which your project differed from the example that was given. How would you recognize it as your own?

trans-unit.source: Assessment
trans-unit.target: 評価

trans-unit.source: Competency scores: 4, 3, 2, 1
trans-unit.target: Competency scores: 4, 3, 2, 1

trans-unit.source: Binary display
trans-unit.target: Binary display

trans-unit.source:
4 = All binary numerals display correctly.
3 = At least 2 binary numerals display correctly.
2 = At least 1 binary numeral displays.
1 = No binary numerals display correctly.
trans-unit.target:
4 = All binary numerals display correctly.
3 = At least 2 binary numerals display correctly.
2 = At least 1 binary numeral displays.
1 = No binary numerals display correctly.

trans-unit.source: micro:bit program
trans-unit.target: micro:bit プログラム

trans-unit.source:
4 = micro:bit program:
* Uses binary in a way that is integral to the program
* Uses mathematical operations to convert decimal-binary
* Compiles and runs as intended
* Meaningful comments in code
3 = micro:bit program lacks 1 of the required elements.
2 = micro:bit program lacks 2 of the required elements.
1 = micro:bit program lacks 3 or more of the required elements.
trans-unit.target:
4 = micro:bit program:
* Uses binary in a way that is integral to the program
* Uses mathematical operations to convert decimal-binary
* 目的通りにコンパイル、実行している
* コードの中に意味のあるコメントがある
3 = micro:bit プラグラムから１つの必要な要素が欠けている。
2 = micro:bit プラグラムから２つの必要な要素が欠けている。
1 = micro:bit プラグラムから３つまたはより多くの必要な要素が欠けている。

trans-unit.source: Reflection
trans-unit.target: 省察

trans-unit.source:
4 = Reflection piece includes addresses all prompts.
3 = Reflection piece lacks 1 of the required elements.
2 = Reflection piece lacks 2 of the required elements.
1 = Reflection piece lacks 3 of the required elements.
trans-unit.target:
4 = Reflection piece includes addresses all prompts.
3 = １つの項目が満たされていない。
2 = ２つの項目が満たされていない。
1 = ３つの項目が満たされていない。

trans-unit.source: Additional questions to ponder
trans-unit.target: Additional questions to ponder

trans-unit.source: How could you use a row of flashlights to represent a number to someone else far away?
trans-unit.target: How could you use a row of flashlights to represent a number to someone else far away?

trans-unit.source: How might you use those flashlights to send a message?
trans-unit.target: How might you use those flashlights to send a message?
